member.summary: Provides the color data format used by the Imager. Also provides the capability related properties.

member.name: P:Symbol.Imaging2.Config.DeviceCapabilityClass.ColorDataFormatClass.Value
member.summary: Gets the color data format used by the Imager.
member.value: A color data format defined in enum.
member.remarks: There are two options, “Planar” and “Chunky”. In Planar mode the RGB data is transferred one plane at a time; first the entire red plane then the entire green plane and finally the entire blue plane. In Chunky mode the RGB data for each pixel is transferred in an interlaced fashion one pixel at a time (R-G-B, R-G-B,…). A OperationFailureException will be thrown if the Imager does not support this parameter.

member.name: T:Symbol.Imaging2.Config.ImageCapabilityClass.FileFormatClass
member.summary: Provides the file format to encapsulate image data in. Also provides the capability related properties.

member.name: P:Symbol.Imaging2.Config.ImageCapabilityClass.FileFormatClass.Value
member.summary:
Gets or sets the file format to encapsulate image data in.
NOTE: When setting the fileformat, please note that freezing feature (which can be enabled by setting Imaging2.Config.Activators.FreezeTimeout to a non-zero value) may not work in any of the following scenarios:
Setting the Config.ImageCapability.FileFormat.Value to TWFF_DIB or TWFF_TIFF. This is due to shortcomings in Microsoft APIs
Setting Config.ImageCapability.FileFormat.Value to TWFF_BMP and Config.DeviceCapability.Resolution.Value to higher resolutions. This depends on the amount of memory available in the application at that time.
member.value: A file format type defined in enum.
member.remarks: A OperationFailureException will be thrown if the Imager does not support this parameter.

member.name: T:Symbol.Imaging2.Config.ImageCapabilityClass.JpegQualityClass
member.summary: Provides the desired JPEG image quality as a percentage. Also provides the capability related properties.

member.name: P:Symbol.Imaging2.Config.ImageCapabilityClass.JpegQualityClass.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired JPEG image quality as a percentage.
member.value: An integer representing the desired JPEG image quality percentage.
member.remarks: Allowed values are from 0 to 100. No assumption is made about the meaning of the range 1 – 99, it may be derived from the JPEG standard or it may be optimized for the device. 100, though, implies a lossless form of compression. Applications are not encouraged to use this value since it results in poor compression, as well as a format that is not currently widely supported in the industry. A value of 0 means no specific quality is requested and the default will be used. A OperationFailureException will be thrown if the Imager does not support this parameter.

member.name: T:Symbol.Imaging2.Config.ImageCapabilityClass.JpegSizeClass
member.summary: Provides the desired size for a JPEG image in Kilo bytes. Also provides the capability related properties.

member.name: P:Symbol.Imaging2.Config.ImageCapabilityClass.JpegSizeClass.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired size for a JPEG image in Kilo bytes.
member.value: The desired size for a JPEG image in Kilo bytes.
member.remarks:
This parameter is ignored if the current value is set to 0. If the current value is greater then 0 then JPEGSize will take precedence over JPEGQuality. The driver will adjust the image quality in order to achieve the size requested by JPEGSize. An image larger than JPEGSize will be returned by a capture method if JPEGSize is smaller than what can be achieved with compression at the lowest quality setting. Conversely, the image returned by GetImage method may be smaller than requested if it was created using the highest quality setting.
JPEGSize only has meaning if the current image file format is JPEG. A OperationFailureException will be thrown if the Imager does not support this parameter.

member.name: P:Symbol.Imaging2.Config.ActivatorsClass.Triggers
member.summary: Get/Set an array of up to 10 triggers on device to activate an image capture. By default it is set to Triggers.ALLTRIGGERS

member.name: P:Symbol.Imaging2.Config.ActivatorsClass.Keys
member.summary: Get/Set an array of up to 4 keys on device to activate an image capture. By default it is set to Keys.Enter.

member.name: P:Symbol.Imaging2.Config.ActivatorsClass.FreezeTimeout
member.summary:
Timeout in milliseconds used to freeze the viewfinder after an image is captured. This can be set to 0 if freezing is not needed. By default it is set to -1 which means it will freeze infinitely until an activator (trigger or key) is pressed. Any negative value passed is taken as -1. The freezing feature requires the control passed to Imaging2.StartViewfinder(control) or Imaging2.StartAcquisition(control) methods to be a System.Windows.Forms.PictureBox object.
NOTE: Freezing the viewfinder is not supported in any of the following scenarios:
Setting the Config.ImageCapability.FileFormat.Value to TWFF_DIB or TWFF_TIFF. This is due to shortcomings in Microsoft APIs
Setting Config.ImageCapability.FileFormat.Value to TWFF_BMP and Config.DeviceCapability.Resolution.Value to higher resolutions. This is due to memory restrictions.

member.param: The PInvokes from an imager object

member.name: M:Symbol.Imaging2.ImageData.GetBitmap
member.summary:
Returns a Bitmap of the image capture.
NOTE: This call may fail to create a Bitmap object in any of the following scenarios:
Setting the Config.ImageCapability.FileFormat.Value to TWFF_DIB or TWFF_TIFF. This is due to shortcomings in Microsoft APIs
Setting Config.ImageCapability.FileFormat.Value to TWFF_BMP and Config.DeviceCapability.Resolution.Value to higher resolutions. This depends on the amount of memory available in the application at that time.
Under these scenarios, this method will return null and no exception is raised. As a work around, ImageData.MemoryStream can be used to access the image data.

member.name: M:Symbol.Imaging2.Imaging2.StartAcquisition
member.summary: Start acquiring image.

member.name: M:Symbol.Imaging2.Imaging2.StartAcquisition(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary:
Start acquiring image and starts sending viewfinder video to the control window. Typically the System.Windows.Forms.PictureBox control is passed into this method.
NOTES:
- If a control other than a PictureBox is used for receiving the video, the Config.Activators.FreezeTimeout must be set to zero. Failure to do so will cause an exception when the CaptureImage() method is called.
- If the control is resized in the application, the viewfinder automatically adjusts itself to the new size.
member.param: Displays the viewfinder in the provided control. If a control other than a PictureBox is used for receiving the video, the Config.Activators.FreezeTimeout must be set to zero. Failure to do so will cause an exception when the CaptureImage() method is called.

member.name: M:Symbol.Imaging2.Imaging2.StopAcquisition
member.summary: Stop acquiring image.

member.name: M:Symbol.Imaging2.Imaging2.StartViewfinder(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary:
Starts sending viewfinder video to the control window. The call will be ignored if viewfinder is already started.
NOTES:
- The freezing feature (which can be enabled by setting Config.Activators.FreezeTimeout to a non-zero value), requires the control passed to this method to be a System.Windows.Forms.PictureBox object. If an incorrect control is passed, an Exception is thrown when CaptureImage methods are called.
- If the control is resized in the application, the viewfinder automatically adjusts itself to the new size.
member.param: Displays the viewfinder in the provided control. The freezing feature (which can be enabled by setting Config.Activators.FreezeTimeout to a non-zero value), requires the control to be a System.Windows.Forms.PictureBox object. If an incorrect control is passed, an Exception is thrown when CaptureImage methods are called.

member.name: T:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs
member.summary: Defines the IDs of different imaging device capabilites.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.DEVCAP_POWERMODE
member.summary: The capability defines the power mode that the imaging device will enter when it is locked but not acquiring. When image acquisition is started with Symbol.Imaging.Imager.StartAcquisition() the power mode will switch to ACQUIRING regardless of the current setting of this capability.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.DEVCAP_XNATIVERESOLUTION
member.summary: The capability returns the native optical resolution along the X-axis of the imaging device.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.DEVCAP_YNATIVERESOLUTION
member.summary: The capability returns the native optical resolution along the Y-axis of the imaging device.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.DEVCAP_COLORFORMAT
member.summary: The capability returns the color format of the pixel data the imaging device is capable of acquiring.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.DEVCAP_BITORDER
member.summary: The capability specifies how the bytes in an image are filled by the Source. BitOrders.MSBFIRST indicates that the leftmost bit in the byte (usually bit 7) is the byte’s Most Significant Bit.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.DEVCAP_PLANEORCHUNKY
member.summary: The capability specifies the available color data formats. There are two options, “Planar” and “Chunky”. In Planar mode the RGB data is transferred one plane at a time; first the entire red plane then the entire green plane and finally the entire blue plane. In Chunky mode the RGB data for each pixel is transferred in an interlaced fashion one pixel at a time (R-G-B, R-G-B,…).

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.DEVCAP_LIGHTSOURCE
member.summary: The capability describes the general color characteristic of the integrated light source.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.DEVCAP_GETIMAGETIMEOUT
member.summary: The capability defines the maximum length of time (in milliseconds) taken for capturing an image. If this capability is non-zero, the internal image capture call will return after the timeout regardless of whether an image was acquired. The ImageData.Result will contain E_IMG_GETIMAGETIMEDOUT if the timeout happened. If this capability is set to zero, then the internal image capture call will only unblock if an image is acquired or the acquisition is stopped.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.DEVCAP_RESOLUTION
member.summary: The capability provides access to the imaging device resolution.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.ACQCAP_FOCUSLENGTH
member.summary: The capability specifies the available focal lengths in millimeters.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.ACQCAP_AUTOEXPOSURE
member.summary: The capability specifies if auto exposure is enabled or not. Enabling this capability effects the capabilities ACQCAP_EXPOSURETIME, ACQCAP_GAINANALOG and ACQCAP_GAINDIGITAL. ACQCAP_EXPOSURETIME: the current value is ignored and an exposure time calculated by the auto exposure algorithm is used instead. ACQCAP_GAINANALOG: the current value is ignored and an analog gain calculated by the auto exposure algorithm is used instead. ACQCAP_GAINDIGITAL: the current value is ignored and a digital gain calculated by the auto exposure algorithm is used instead. If the imager is acquiring with auto exposure enabled and GetImage() is called to read an image, the values of the above capabilities as calculated by the algorithm may be retrieved using the GetLastAcqParams(...) function followed by the respective property for the capability. The target brightness that the auto exposure algorithm will attempt to achieve may be set using the ACQCAP_BRIGHTNESS capability.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.ACQCAP_BRIGHTNESS
member.summary: capability specifies the target brightness that the auto exposure algorithm will attempt to achieve. This capability is only meaningful if ACQCAP_AUTOEXPOSURE is enabled.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.ACQCAP_EXPOSURETIME
member.summary: The capability specifies the exposure time in microseconds. The current value of this capability is ignored if the ACQCAP_AUTOEXPOSURE capability is enabled.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.ACQCAP_GAINANALOG
member.summary: The capability specifies the amount of analog gain to apply. The current value of this capability is ignored if the ACQCAP_AUTOEXPOSURE capability is enabled.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.ACQCAP_GAINDIGITAL
member.summary: The capability specifies the amount of digital gain to apply.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.ACQCAP_LAMPSTATE
member.summary: The capability specifies if the lamp should be used during image acquisition. If enabled the lamp will be turned on during the exposure phase of image acquisition.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.ACQCAP_AIMING
member.summary: The capability specifies the way that the aiming reticule should be enabled. If capability’s value is set to NORMAL or PICKLIST the aiming reticule will be turned on as long as image acquisition has been started with StartAcquisition(). If it's set to NORMAL then the aiming reticule will automatically turn off during the exposure phase of image acquisition so that it does not appear in the captured image. If it's set to PICKLIST then the aiming reticule will not turn off during exposure and will be visible in the captured image.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.ACQCAP_AESETTLE
member.summary: The capability defines the degree to which the autoexposure algorithm must settle before GetImage() will return an image. This capability has no effect if the ACQCAP_AUTOEXPOSURE capability is disabled. Setting this value too low may cause GetImage() fail to return an image under certain lighting conditions. The default value for this capability should ensure adequate settling. This feature may be disabled by setting this capability to 0. With ACQCAP_AESETTLE disabled GetImage() will return the first acquired image regardless of the state of the autoexposure algorithm.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.ACQCAP_AEFRAMESKIP
member.summary: The capability specifies the number of frames to skip between auto exposure updates. This capability is only meaningful if ACQCAP_AUTOEXPOSURE is enabled.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.IMGCAP_FILEFORMAT
member.summary: The capability specifies the file format to encapsulate image data in.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.IMGCAP_JPEGQUALITY
member.summary: The capability specifies the desired JPEG image quality as a percentage. No assumption is made about the meaning of the range 1 - 99, it may be derived from the JPEG standard or it may be optimized for the device. 100, though, implies a lossless form of compression. Applications are not encouraged to use this value since it results in poor compression, as well as a format that is not currently widely supported in the industry. A value of 0 means no specific quality is requested and the default will be used. IMGCAP_JPEGSIZE takes priority over this capability. This capability will be ignored if the current value of IMGCAP_JPEGSIZE is not 0. This capability only has meaning if the current value of IMGCAP_FILEFORMAT is FileFormats.JPEG.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.IMGCAP_JPEGSIZE
member.summary: The capability specifies the desired size for a JPEG image in Kilo bytes. This capability is ignored if the current value is set to 0. If the current value is greater than 0 then this capability will take precedence over IMGCAP_JPEGQUALITY. The driver will adjust the image quality in order to achieve the size requested by IMGCAP_JPEGSIZE. An image larger then IMGCAP_JPEGSIZE will be returned by GetImage() if IMGCAP_JPEGSIZE is smaller than what can be achieved with compression at the lowest quality setting. Conversely, the image returned by GetImage() may be smaller than requested if it was created using the highest quality setting. This capability only has meaning if the current value of IMGCAP_FILEFORMAT is FileFormats.JPEG.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.IMGCAP_CROPX
member.summary: The capability specifies, in pixels, the X coordinate of the top, left corner of the rectangle that will be used to crop the acquired image.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.IMGCAP_CROPY
member.summary: The capability specifies, in pixels, the Y coordinate of the top, left corner of the rectangle that will be used to crop the acquired image.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.IMGCAP_CROPWIDTH
member.summary: The capability specifies, in pixels, the width of the rectangle that will be used to crop the acquired image. If the current value is set to 0 this capability will be ignored and the device will use a width that encompasses the entire acquired image.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.IMGCAP_CROPHEIGHT
member.summary: The capability specifies, in pixels, the height of the rectangle that will be used to crop the acquired image. If the current value is set to 0 this capability will be ignored and the device will use a height that encompasses the entire acquired image.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.IMGCAP_MATCHVFCAPCROP
member.summary: The capability specifies if the cropping defined for the viewfinder should be used for image retrieval as well. If TRUE then the following capabilities IMGCAP_CROPX, IMGCAP_CROPY, IMGCAP_CROPWIDTH and IMGCAP_CROPHEIGHT are ignored. The capabilities VFCAP_CROPX, VFCAP_CROPY, VFCAP_CROPWIDTH and VFCAP_CROPHEIGHT are used instead.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.IMGCAP_FLIPHORIZONTAL
member.summary: The capability specifies if acquired image should be flipped on the horizontal axis.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.IMGCAP_FLIPVERTICAL
member.summary: The capability specifies if the acquired image should be flipped on the vertical axis.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.IMGCAP_ROTATE
member.summary: The capability specifies the amount, in degrees, that the acquired image should be rotated. NOTE: This capability is not supported.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.IMGCAP_NEGATIVE
member.summary: The capability specifies if the bits in the acquired image should be negated.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.VFCAP_CROPX
member.summary: The capability specifies, in pixels, the X coordinate of the top, left corner of the rectangle that will be used to crop the viewfinder image.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.VFCAP_CROPY
member.summary: The capability specifies, in pixels, the Y coordinate of the top, left corner of the rectangle that will be used to crop the viewfinder image.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.VFCAP_CROPWIDTH
member.summary: The capability specifies, in pixels, the width of the rectangle that will be used to crop the viewfinder image. If the current value is set to 0 this capability will be ignored and the device will use a width that encompasses the entire viewfinder image.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.VFCAP_CROPHEIGHT
member.summary: The capability specifies, in pixels, the height of the rectangle that will be used to crop the viewfinder image. If the current value is set to 0 this capability will be ignored and the device will use a height that encompasses the entire viewfinder image.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.VFCAP_CROPSTYLE
member.summary: The capability specifies how the cropped area is displayed.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.VFCAP_FIXASPECTRATIO
member.summary: The capability specifies if the aspect ratio of the viewfinder image is forced to match that of the acquired image. The aspect ratio of the viewfinder window is defined by VFCAP_WINWIDTH / VFCAP_WINHEIGHT . The aspect ratio of the imaging device is defined by DEVCAP_XNATIVERESOLUTION / DEVCAP_YNATIVERESOLUTION . If VFCAP_FIXASPECTRATIO is TRUE then the acquired image is proportionally scaled so that it fits into the viewfinder window. The viewfinder window will not be completely filled with image data if the viewfinder window aspect ratio does not match the device aspect ratio. If FALSE the acquired image is scaled, disproportionately if necessary, to completely fill the viewfinder window.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.VFCAP_FRAMERATE
member.summary: The capability indicates the current frame rate of the viewfinder in frames per second.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.VFCAP_WINX
member.summary: The capability specifies, in pixels, the X coordinate of the display rectangle.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.VFCAP_WINY
member.summary: The capability specifies, in pixels, the Y coordinate of the display rectangle.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.VFCAP_WINWIDTH
member.summary: The capability specifies, in pixels, the width of the display rectangle.

member.name: F:Symbol.Imaging2.CapIDs.VFCAP_WINHEIGHT
member.summary: The capability specifies, in pixels, the height of the display rectangle.
